content: so you now have your cardi all that s left is an edging i started at the the great british granny shrug middle back and did a double into each stitch all the way around joining with a slip_stitch all in cream for corners i did a *double_crochet ch2 double_crochet* into the space each time then i changed to red and did a double into every stitch until i got to designed by eleanor burke and brought to you by knit where i wanted button holes i counted actually one stitch from the nottingham edge and then three sets of four stitches in button hole bit *ch2 miss a stitch double_crochet into next 4 stitches* repeat you might want to put more or less button holes in though and feel free carry on with your red and slip_stitch to join change to cream and do a double into every stitch one into every button hole space slip_stitch to join stitchtionary - uk terms what you ll need chain chain 150g ish aran weight yarn join slip_stitch 5mm crochet hook treble_crochet treble sewing up needle break yarn sew in ends sew on shiny buttons bish bash bosh buttons double_crochet double_crochet copyright eleanor burke 2012 copyright eleanor burke 2012 hexagrannies make two the same place each hexagon face down on your lap/the table pinch the corner at the beginning of the round and bring that point to it s exact my stripe sequence one row each of cream red cream blue opposite folding the hexagon in half it should look like a right angle do the same for the other hexagon using mattress stitch or whatever chain 4 join in the round you prefer sew the hexagons together along one side making sure that the beginning of the round corners mirror eachother this is the back round 1 ch3 2tr into circle *ch2 3tr into circle* repeat 5 times ch2 join of your cardi round 2 ch3 2trs into space just before the join * 3tr ch2 3tr into corner* repeat 5 times 3tr ch2 join round 3 ch3 2tr into the space just before the join *3tr into the next space 3tr ch2 3tr into corner* repeat 5 times 3tr into next space 3tr into corner ch2 and join round 4 and all further rounds ch3 2tr into the space just before the join *3tr into each space 3tr ch2 3tr into corner repeat 5 times 3tr into each space 3tr into corner ch2 join repeat round four until the radius measurement from centre to edge measures a quarter of the full bust measurement needed roughly 3 5 9cm for a newborn 4 10 25cm for 0-3 months 4 5 11 5cm for 3-6 months 5 12 75cm for 6-12 months 5 5 14cm for 12-18 months now identify the arms they re the ones stuck out of the side sew along the top of these to enclose the arms stopping short a couple of and so on if you re
